bow: 23 and want to have kids young how long should wait based off your experience some background on my current scenario 23 with good job annually about 50k about 17k in student debt with boyfriend of about years now always hear that you should wait and definitely open to that especially if that will be best for future kids and myself know it no cake walk my few factors for wanting to start young is want to be mom want kids while fit and healthy and can run around with them want to have big family min ideal and want to be decently young grandparent ve always been told there is no great time to have kid want to travel but every time do feel like it detracting away from what actually want ask my mom what she thinks but she died when was and she was 33 was the youngest of so mommies of reddit when did you have your kids and how did it turn out ll answer any questions you may have if that ll help give you advice edit wow love the stories keep them coming all great things want to hear and everyone so far has at least one nugget of wisdom my husband and had twins when he was 21 and was 23 we were married at that time and went back to finish college when the twins were months old we had another baby when the twins turned finished college and have good job my husband has good job we have nice house and our kids have everything they need and lots of things they do my point is that while it ideal to wait until you are older because you are typically more settled in your life you should base your decision soley on social norms my husband and are glad we had kids early because we will be in our early 40s when the kids are all out of the house and we will have lots of time for travel and to spend time with our kids and grandkids bottom line you do you if you want kids now have kids now we had baby when was 23 and my husband was 25 the pregnancy was ahead of schedule but we welcomed it and figured out budget that works was lucky that finished school before the baby was born and that my husband makes enough that can stay home with the baby until she starts preschool bounced back physically pretty fast and found that the sleepless nights were *that* bad in the beginning idk it different for everyone here what tell my kids before you have kids of your own it will be easiest if you have steady job steady finances home of your own not living with mom transportation phone committed partner recommend being married it sounds like you re well on your way if not already there being ready has less to do with age and more to do with stability imho gt want to travel but every time do feel like it detracting away from what actually want you can travel with kid just takes more planning friend of mine sister got her daughter passport before she was even year old so they could travel with her my parents traveled tons with me and my sister travel and munchkins are not mutually exclusive was 27 when was born and glad did start earlier though is always wanted to have kids young there really no rush it changes your life forever no way around it not saying that bad but it good to appreciate each stage of life as you live it without longing for the next if you want to travel do it now not casually but make plan and really do some serious satisfying traveling so later you can look back and remember that awesome time not that you ca travel with kids but it totally different that said if you are financially stable and in committed healthy stable long term relationship too recommend marriage there no reason now could be the right time for you to start having kids if you both feel it the right time still say do rush it though and that coming from someone who definitely wanted to have kids before 25 now 28 with on the way and am glad had those child free years 23 now with kiddos and love it my advice based on the info you provided it will help your life *immensely* to get married first and then give yourself some time as married couple before you have kids the first couple years of our marriage was somewhat hell ish and think that because we got pregnant first and only had six months between getting married and baby being born and even now coming up on five years we still have lot of past hurts we re working through and thankfully we have some healthy communication tools that are really helpful but really wish could have had that time to establish our marriage before kids and that being not only for the sake of our marriage but for the sake of our kids too want my kids to see their parents having healthy loving relationship and that was struggle to start out with got married at 19 and got pregnant few months after got married had six kids over the next nine years after twelve years of marriage got divorced and coparent with my ex husband and my new husband we are all very close and maintain bonds as family the children live with my husband and me but see their father every day except for right now as he is in another state wrapping up business venture but other than this he never been away from them and we agreed to live within mile of each other so that we always have access to the children am now 31 weeks pregnant with my seventh child my first with my new husband 35 and half with regard to the physical aspects being younger was million times better pregnancy at 35 sucks so much remember when was pregnant with my first was painting the living room at 35 weeks right now trip to the grocery store is too much for me but this varies widely from woman to woman so many other older moms have much different experiences than do with regard to emotional psychological social impact on my life definitely much more patient and knowledgeable now than was when got married but was definitely an enthusiastic hands on deeply attached parent because was so young had lot of energy to be really really involved in every aspect of my older children day my oldest son first sentence was go away mom because was constantly up in his grill trying to make sure he knew the alphabet by the time he was one and freaking out about every developmental milestone much much more laid back now financially have lot more money now than did when had my first son financial worry comprised huge portion of my stress in the first four years of parenthood for me one of the benefits of starting young for me is that ve done lot of things in my thirties now that my older kids are teenagers that most women do in their twenties so did really miss out just did things in different order or in the case of getting my masters much more slowly and later never would have expected to be divorced and remarrying at 33 but now that 35 and expecting child with two teenagers two preteens and two school aged kids it really fun and fascinating to watch them get so excited about new sibling all that to say no matter how you plan it may not turn out as you expected but if you re doing your best and pursuing what you think is best and making responsible choices you probably wo have regret also having baby especially just one does not need to curtail travel we take our kids with us and we start taking them to restaurants theater and live events at birth they quickly learn by example how to behave in well mannered way and enjoy adventure wanted to start young and grew up religious so it very common in my religion for girls to get married around 20 and have their first child by 21 had great career by 21 and was happily married we went through infertility for years and we adopted baby months ago 24 and my husband is 31 we are very financially stable and have nice home that being said agree with you that having child young is nice when you have the energy but the first week we had our son was so unbelievably difficult was so grateful for our years of infertility know that sounds bad and the travel we had done love our son but transition to mommyhood was so much harder than thought especially since we waited so long for him to come into our lives in the years before though we took lot of amazing trips while we tried to get pregnant and those memories the bonding time with my partner am so happy we were able to do that before our baby changed everything so you re right that as long as you re financially stable independent and in happy and committed relationship there no ideal age but if you want to travel think it important to do that now im really happy we did before baby having more bonding time with my husband to explore and be on adventures together strengthened us for the task of being parents and feel much more prepared to start this new chapter had my first one when was 26 and she turned out very healthy had my second one was was 32 and he has had several health problems big fan of starting young for all the reasons you mention good advice but traveling now will only hurt your finances if you want to be ready for kids buckle down and save financial stability is huge wish had done as much fun stuff before having kids think of all the money and time wasted not all fun is waste but wish would have done as much then we potentially would have had our house down payment we are now thinking of adopting one day and that makes us have to reevaluate our finances again it great to see some of this here still have fun but since planning to one day have children so trying to get my life and finances in order so many people are telling me do two week trip to europe it ll change your life etc sure it will but road trip to log cabin in the woods for days for 8th of the cost is still really wonderful too had mine at 23 planned and she is now since having her have actually had the chance to travel the world with my little lady in tow and its amazing loved having her young only downside is that was literally the first so had no oh let me tell you about that or awesome hand me downs buy these products also had bit of trouble with play dates luckly when moved overseas many people have kids my daughters age so it worked out just depends on what you want your experience to be always willing to answer your questions if need it when the time comes my daughter was 18 months when we moved overseas been to countries in the last year and half do stop doing what you love just because you have children it can be done if you have steady job home loving partner who is on the same page as you say go for it had my kid at 21 22 wish had waited to now 30 knew *nothing* at 21 and although had good intentions was not fit to be parent you are definately better off financially than was at that age but there lot to be said for life experience and wisdom that just comes with age you will make different decisions for your family in your 30s than you would in your 20s mentally emotionally think its better to wait but that my cents agree with this immensly your life does have to stop it just adapts had my first at 22 second at 24 do it again my husband had steady job but did was still in school and working full time at target but have an awesome support system so much more energy and pregnancy delivery recovery were easy peasy have so much fun at every step and really am still kid myself at 28 would really love to add more to my family but we re not on the same page and refuse to have kids after 30 so also running out of time my family is one of those who had kids young but still have good careers my grand parents are only 69 my mom just turned 50 so we have generational component would trade had my daughter at 23 and now 32 and pregnant with my 3rd totally agree that being younger and pregnant was so so much easier not only did get my figure back much easier but was still able to go out and enjoy myself both while pregnant and after having kids never stopped me from doing the things that wanted and it gave me great excuse to do all the silly kid things again yes had no money but my daughter had everything she needed and now she is older had more besides having her younger has given me the ability to space my pregnancies out and focus on each child when their demands were highest my husband and were 24 when our first was born we were married at 21 and finished college before planning to start family we were broke but we knew we wanted to have as much time years future as we could with our kids and that we would find ways to make it work we are glad we did wait when my oldest now was just 6mo old my husband started suffering from an intestinal infection that lasted for months and left damage and pain then he survived heart attack genetic cholesterol disorder that we were unaware of since he was active and fit when my youngest now was about 6mo old we are still broke most of the time but get by we would change anything about when we had our kids though what if the heart attack scared us off of having kids or we decided it was going to be too much for us after that yes one now has the cholesterol disorder but we are well aware and can monitor and manage it it has been rough but we love our little boys and the family we have created since we are still young we have the energy to keep up with them and give them the attention they need our family is the perfect size for us and we do not have plans for any more babies except if somehow accidental because we have lot going on as it is and we worry if we have baby when older that we risk having one with special needs which we would rather avoid happening with the current health issues we already have in the home but would change anything think it depends on you and when you are ready am not believer of trying to wait just so you can have fun and such but if you are not comfortable having children when finances are big struggle or you feel you could not properly provide then do recommend waiting marriage is always great start as it shows you and your partner commitment to each other it will help when there fight or disagreement to help you push harder to solve it which is important when looking out for your children since they see everything you do and learn from it it good to see the variety of opinions and thoughts most of my friends feel the way you do but do have kids they just say kids ruin your life and that it it good to see mix of it okay right now and wait and here are the reasons why from actual moms kids are awesome but they are stress embodied life is just more full with kid and relationship problems tend to be revealed under stress so second this definitely do think kids ruin your life love my kid and think he added wondeful element to my life but worry more that ruining *his* life and think would have made better mom for him if had waited agree only you know when is right but the biggest piece of advice can give is to travel all you want now pregnancy nursing having multiples you may not have chance to travel again til retirement you know went to college and traveled the world did london study traveled in italy lived in china for year and do regret doing that however as mom of two small kids one of the things look forward to the absolute most is traveling with my children when they get old enough to remember understand we do little trips around our area now and being able to experience the world with them is probably one of the highlights of my life it so much better than doing it on my own 26 and just had my baby have been married years and we live in townhome and have steady jobs mine is work from home job too my husband is job hunting while working to get us out of this small town we hate decided it was time to have baby when started crying when saw pregnant women live in utah in the us and people have kids young here my sister was 23 with her first and another sister got pregnant months after getting married at 24 and both of those are somewhat old in utah standards have many friends my same age with kids the less stable you are in your job and relationship the harder having baby is going to be but if you have stable jobs and stable relationship it makes it little easier wanted have kid earlier than most people because my mom was old when she had me and was she did have enough time for all of her kids and now her body is so destroyed from playing sports in college and age that she ca play with her grandchildren and do want that played sports too and my body is pretty destroyed so figured whatever advantage could get was going to take want to be able to be energetic and have fun with my kids and my grandchildren if have any my best friend had her first kid at 18 had my first at 29 she feels that she did get to do much like travel but is happy her kids will be out of the house when she is young 38 got to do lot before having my daughter travel sports grad school but also just starting my adult career and it rough transition wish had been more settled job wise prior to getting pregnant really any time you have kid you ll probably think oh could have waited or wish had done first guess what did realize going from kid is that literally every single aspect of your life changes and it begins with pregnancy was exhausted still kinda am everything ate wore and did was dictated by the fact that my kiddo was growing inside of me she toddler now and her schedule still pretty much runs the show ca just go grab gallon of milk quickly last night was pondering going to the er and was excited about it since my husband would have had to drive me and that meant taking her with us you see think people should have kids when they re fully prepared to put their lives on pause for few years and sure there are tons of people who continue travel or start phd with newborns and stuff go them but realistically jobs finances being tired will all make that more dream than doable unlikely but still possible is having child with health problems 27 and healthy and so is my husband and my son was born months early and because of that has many complications our lives will be much different than expected obviously this can happen at any age but to be 23 and have extra responsibilities and worries vs 32 it would vary for everyone imagine just realize your life may change more than expected had my kids at 35 and 38 ve been financially ready to have kids since my mid to late twenties mentally was ready to be mom at 30 having traveled and made some strides in my career did find someone to have kids with until 30 due to some health problems had to wait few years before trying to get pregnant so here am at 38 with an infant and three year old both my pregnancies were easy was carrying around my oldest the day went into labor with my second and ve had plenty of energy to play with the three year old at my age ve had ton of life experience and feel like going to be better teacher to my kids but man the sleep deprivation with two kids is killing me right now and think would be handling it better if was younger also by the time hopefully become grandparent going to be really old and that makes me feel bad my parents and sister both had kids around 30 and to me that is ideal you are old enough to know some things and you ll still have energy when your grand kids come along this is just my opinion was ready to have kids at 23 and it sounds like you are deleted im 34 and we just had our first ive been with my husband since was 20 and wanted to be young mom for pretty much the same reasons however have no regrets waiting as long as we did and here are some reasons why we have matured together as couple and now bringing in child feel that we have been able to handle things much better due to the depth and comfort level of our bond we got to enjoy our 20s traveling staying out late throwing lots of parties gaming etc we paid off all of our debt and bought house we are way more financially secure now than we were ever before both of us have had major career changes in the last 10 years he decided to entirely change his career after bad situation at former employer and my department was eliminated so was out of job after almost 10 years with my company shit happens even when its not your fault we were able to really plan things about as much as you can when we decided to start trying all in all im glad we waited feel have had so much more life experience than would have if we had children earlier also dont ever feel trapped or resentful im stay at home mom did the career bit the partying bit the selfish bit now can focus just on my little one or ones we plan to have more and dont feel like im missing out or have to sacrifice too much gon na be truthful wish had kids sooner had my son at 27 and honestly wish had him when was younger had my baby at 33 and am soooo glad waited my husband and got to travel and see lot of the world together we both got to enjoy our 20s and grow up we were sure we wanted any kids until around 30 and do think we were ready to give up our own hobbies and travels earlier my baby is just months old and now look forward to doing the things love with her it definitely changes your life dramatically barely have time to shower most days much less paint or exercise or watch the shows used to enjoy know it will change as she gets older and more independent but it requires giving up lot especially in the first year was in decent shape before pregnancy and did prenatal yoga throughout my body bounced back pretty quickly do know how it would have been when was younger had horrible horrible morning 24 sickness until around 16 weeks but after that pregnancy was bad had natural unmedicated labor and both baby and were totally fine had minor tears and stitches if you and your partner are both ready go for it for us travel and experiencing different cultures is important so we did as much as we could before trying to get pregnant now we ca wait to share future travels with our daughter evaluate your priorities and do whatever makes the most sense and the most happiness for you 25 and just had my 3rd son who weeks old my older sons are and on one hand wish we could have waited until my husband and had been married for few years so we could have gotten to know each other and travel as couple first was 20 and he was 24 when we got married was already pregnant with our first son we never got honey moon and we ve never vacationed together but also thankful because ve been able to bounce back faster physically and have more energy for my toddlers and the nighttime newborn feeds on top of what others have said highly recommend having lifestyle that an be supported on one income it gives you extra money to play with or save and safety net during bad economic times deleted was 28 when had my first now 30 he 21 months think it will be hard for those of us who had kids older to comfortable with if want to grow my family really regret all the waiting we did for the right time had my first baby at 34 husband was 33 am so incredibly glad we waited first off ll say make sure married in regards to travel 24 from the us and got pregnant with babe at 23 ve been married for years and bought house right before we married we make about the same amount of money as you do although that guess based on your income we have traveled we had to save throughout the year and do one big vacation every other year but it important to us to travel we actually went to england while was pregnant and we have cruise planned when babe is 11 months old ca wait to take her to new places and explore wanted to be young when we had kids and while it is stressful and weird to have newborn when my friends are still bar going and just settling down would change it my mom was 21 when she had me and admire her relationship with my dad and hope can the same relationship with babe as what have with my mom to be fair it is hard on your relationship so be sure your relationship with your boyfriend can handle lot of financial stress and just life stress sorry this is so long thanks time helps and new healthy squishy baby helps pain like that becomes just another part of you instead of defining you like it does at first always said wanted to wait so could travel and all that honestly barely had vacation time my husband either and we spent all our money on house and maintaining it then looked at my parents who had tons of freedom in their early 40s because me and my sister were old enough to take care of ourselves they were more financially stable and had more expendable money so decided having kids younger made more sense was 26 which is really all that young but considering now almost 30 and most of my friends still do have any kids we were young do regret it for second in fact not sure have the energy for it if waited much longer would have loved to do more traveling and we re in better place to do to it now but it still would have been restricted to when could get vacation that lined up with my husband you can still travel with kids too granted it harder and it changes your destination choices but you can still do it yeah it mostly because had hyperemesis gravidarum with this one but also because of complications related to age gd etc but as said most women know say pregnancy was worse at an older age but many women know have different experience just much more tired and feeling too old for this luckily have been able to stay active enough that have only gained less than 20 pounds or that would make it much worse there is no right answer here it is very individual decision and lots of things can work out really well that said my general advice is to take things as they come you may respond to motherhood differently than you think and you do want to feel trapped in anything grew up the oldest grand daughter in large religious family so had been babysitting all my life with few summers under my belt as live in nanny to infants was certain would want lot of kids would breastfeed them and would stay home with them as least most of the time after got married just after turning 22 decided to set up financial stability and get away from my abusive family before we had kids then found really loved working and loved having money and taking trips to adults only resorts and generally spending time with my husband after being married years we were both longing for child and had son by this point had reduced my ideal to kids but after having my son discovered that really missed my job and was counting the days to the end of my maternity leave to get back to it love my son and am discovering what motherhood means to me more each day but at this point do know if will have any more kids ironically my best friend who thought she might never want kids ended up leaving her job and feeling very fulfilled as stay at home mom so you do know for sure how you will actually feel one of the best reasons for waiting the years to have kids was that our marriage and bank account was able to weather the storm of having child that did not sleep for years if we had our son few years earlier would have had to move in with my parents or my in laws and think would have been looking for divorce by the end of it was completely shocked at how hard motherhood hit me physically and emotionally hope that your transition is smoother than mine was but if it is then you ll need constant support from your partner and either your families or as in my case lots of hired help you re not wrong but marriage does include legal protections that may not exist in other marriage like arrangements so it worth looking into before deciding one way or the want to share that with them more than anything obviously some trips are kid friendly so just decide if that important to you or not love being young mom so far felt ready and just wanted to share my for you it definitely going into the saved link for me one time reading of all these experiences does give it justice had my first at 23 was like you and wanted to have kids young for all the reasons above have no regrets you have way too many kids well thanks like them all so just going to go ahead and keep them all if that ok there is no right time to have kids for sure but some times are better than others for individuals at different times in their lives my only advice at any age would be to do some very deep soul searching about your relationship before having children with someone divorce and separation after child are by no means the worst thing that can happen but ending relationship that has produced child is so much more complicated than one without child assuming both of you want to continue being part of the child life would honestly put this before many other considerations got married months after turned 21 my son was born almost exactly months after my husband and got married when had just turned 22 two months before and have pretty mixed feeling about it always wanted to be young mom but we just were really prepared to be parents yet not that we re terrible sometimes tight but it never been too bad we ve never gone without things we ve needed the only thing sometimes do like about it is that all my friends are out doing fun things and ca go with them because have year old it does suck sometimes and get jealous but still do regret having my son the way see it is there will be time for traveling and things when my husband are in our 40 and my son is off to college or whatever he wants to do with his life plus traveling with kids is doable you just have to adjust your expectations there will never be right time to have kids you just have to decide what your main priorities are and adjust your life to meet them if having kids young is priority for you then you ll be fine with doing all the fun things later my mom was 19 when was born and though it was irresponsible having kid at her age without money career stable partner etc ve always loved that she had so much energy and she was kind of the cool crazy mom became mom in december was 19 now 20 and it amazing do regret it it was planned but his dad and have been together for four years and everything is perfect it is hard to keep up with what we re studying but do want to stop doing it so just doing everything at the same time if you want to be young mom go for it you still somehow have time for reddit so suppose you can keep them yes that true we re reasonably lucky here with de facto kids do want kids head over to childfree to see the other side of that equation gt the thing is though that that often just does happen and when it does it totally different type of traveling that is half as adventurous yes this we have traveled all over with our 15 month old daughter she been on 20+ flights but holy shit is travel an entirely different beast now now stuck in hotels apartments during naptime because we have child that refuses to nap in her stroller carrier we also have toddler that goes to bed at 6:30pm so late night dinners evening strolls *any* night time activities out of the question we realized early on that we have to pony up extra money for one bedroom suites in hotels because if we did we be putting our baby toddler to bed at 6:30pm and then sitting in the dark making no noise so we did wake up the baby while traveling with the little one we now have very set amount of time in between eating and nap time bed time to go see things it completely changes how you travel we re going to spain this spring and we re taking nanny with us it seems ludicrous for three adults to be there for one child but we realized we really wanted to *enjoy* our vacation we re going for two weeks and the nanny will alternate working the morning early afternoon half of the day or the late afternoon evening half of the day we ll still get plenty of opportunities for late night dinners explorations and wanderings but also get plenty of time with our little one you already have lots of comments here so will tell you what did 23 married my now husband we bought our first house 24 paid off debt bought new car to replace dhs 25 vacations savings 26 dream trip to australia started trying 27 bought larger house had first kid replaced second car there have been few times we ve been strapped for cash in the beginning but we both have degrees and great jobs and we commute from the burbs to have the space and finances we want we love to travel and we made that priority first because god it going to be forever until we can again do it now we also it is listed visited his family up north at least once year good luck do what works for you wait few years your twenties especially your early twenties are for making mistakes and taking chances you learn lot about yourself and your partner in that time there is lots of time to have kids live in the present for little while learn who you are what you really like challenge yourself to try new hobbies and go new places before adding mom to your description having children is like living in frat house nobody sleeps everything broken and there lot of throwing up ray romano dad here so hope you do mind me jumping in 500hats said it perfectly steady income your own place transportation phone and committed partner with that said it true that there never right time or wrong time for kids my wife and wanted to wait couple years after marriage to discuss kids especially since multiple doctors told her while growing up that conception would be extremely difficult if at all possible short version her uterus is completely flipped we ended up with honeymoon baby we had all the other previously mentioned requirements except financial stability we were ready financially and we struggled for long time however we would change it for the world because parenthood has been the best thing for us watching our daughter now four years old grow and learn the only other thing you need to remember is priorities often joke about how wanted to name our kid after their designated chores dishwasher laundry lawn mower bring daddy beer in that order and how the day will come when tell my daughter sorry baby but school lunch will have to wait because daddy got new video game preordered but your kids will always have to come first obviously you will miss the days when you were single not parent once in while baby first christmas we all got the same stomach virus on christmas eve mama and daddy spent all night playing pass the baby while running for the toilet but promise it worth it all the bad stuff the sick nights the doctor hospital visits the explosive diapers the sleeplessness etc are greatly overshadowed by the good things the cuddles the unconditional love they give watching them learn and grow watching them succeed all of their many firsts however while your first priority will and should always be your kids you can not neglect yourself when the kid has slept in days take turns with your partner so you each get some sleep even if it means kicking each other to family member or friend house for few hours or overnight to catch up on some sleep your days of going out alone or as couple may be much more limited but they are no less important you ll both still need that time out with your friends and with each other to just decompress and have fun if becoming mom is calling for you then talk about it see how your boyfriend feels had my first kid at 23 had my second one at 25 will say wait and save and do all the things you want to do before having kids do regret having my boys young but do regret not doing all the things wanted to do before kids like finish college travel live on my own and only have to worry about myself for while suggest getting that debt down bit and find nice steady job that ll be helpful time wise maternity leave and stable always wanted kids that being said waited until was 31 to start trying to get pregnant we were married for year although we had been living together for total of years may be old and tired now just had baby but do not regret waiting to have kids it was the perfect time for us and we had just finished marriage workshop class together that being said it really up to you when you feel like you are ready the only thing would caution is that you mention you have boyfriend of years kids are lifetime commitment and generally speaking they tend to cause problems in relationships almost every relationship gets rocky once the baby comes along even previously perfect relationships if both of you are not mentally in position to be ready to get married you are both probably not in mental position to be ready for children and always encourage first time pregnant mom to take relationship class or marriage counseling with their partner before the baby arrives you would be surprised at the unspoken and often contradictory expectations each partner will have of the other with regards to child rearing while this is all certainly true was actually comparing traveling before having kids to traveling after your kids have grown up and left the house since that when most young parents envision doing their traveling the thing is when you re older the last thing you want is group of drunk 20 somethings stumbling into your hostel dorm waking you up at stupid clock in the morning so you stay in private rooms or proper hotels you stick together with your husband wife and while you certainly have good time it more private time doing planned activities when you re in your 20s even if you re not one of those stumbling in drunk your dorm mates are the people you end up befriending along your journey and have impromptu side adventures with they re the ones who say hey bunch of us are going rock climbing at insert popular climbing spot want to join us and then you go along and learn to rock climb because why the hell not some of the greatest adventures traveling are result of meeting other random travelers and doing spontaneous activities with them there so much less of that when you re older and do stay in hostels if you want to have kids soon would prioritize paying your student debt over traveling disagree with another poster think having your own home is important especially if we are talking starter
